text: Yes, a search for our blog listing pages, and then a mega blog listing page that combines 4 different blogs
So blogs can not be "filtered" so much as you can grab them by topic
The reason is that you can have a maximum of 200 posts displayed at a time.
Ok, that’s what I thought… I think I’ve resided to #1 and #2 being no’s, but do you know if there’s a way to suppress the html markup in #3?
Using the api endpoint provided by HubSpot
If you edit the search module you can see
Btw.. you can do a lot with a topic sort.

Right… I’m actually using React to render cards for each post that’s returned… but currently the “title” area in the cards is set up for plain text only. And the api returns that extra span tag, which is currently printing out as plain text. So as the easy solution, I was hoping there was a parameter I could set in the API request to suppress that span tag from getting inserted. Otherwise I’ll have to either regex that out with javascript, or set up that card to accept it, sanitize it and insert it via dangerously set html.
But I couldn’t find anything in the documentation about that
Hoping it would be something like adding `&highlight=false` to the get request
And thanks for the help <@U38EZFVFE>! Much appreciated!
Yeah no problem. If you need any dev assistance. We are more than cappable and willing to help out.
